Name: Loan contract
Details:
Article 667 stipulates that a loan contract is a contract whereby the borrower borrows money from the lender and repays the principal and pays interest when due. 
Article 668 stipulates that a loan contract shall be in writing, except for the loan between natural persons where there is an agreement otherwise. The loan contract generally includes clauses such as the type of currency, the amount, the purpose, the interest rate, the term and the method of repayment. 
Article 670 stipulates that the interest of the loan shall not be deducted from the principal in advance. If the interest is deducted from the principal in advance, the loan shall be repaid and the interest shall be calculated based on the actual amount of the loan provided. 
Article 671 stipulates that if the lender fails to provide the loan in accordance with the agreement, causing losses to the borrower, it shall compensate for the losses. If the borrower fails to take the loan in accordance with the agreement, it shall still pay the interest in accordance with the agreement during the agreed loan period. 
Article 675 stipulates that the borrower shall repay the loan principal and interest in accordance with the agreed time limit. If the time limit is not agreed upon or the agreement is unclear, and it cannot be determined in accordance with the provisions of Article 510 of this Law, the borrower may repay it at any time; the lender may demand that the borrower repay it within a reasonable time limit. 
Article 676 stipulates that if the borrower fails to repay the due loan, it shall pay the overdue interest in accordance with the agreement or the relevant national regulations. 
Article 680 stipulates that the interest rate of loans shall not violate the national regulations on interest rate limits. For loans between natural persons where the interest is not agreed upon or the agreement is unclear, it shall be deemed that there is no interest. For loans between natural persons where the interest is agreed upon, the interest rate shall not exceed the interest rate limits specified by the national competent department.

Name: Sales contract
Details:
Article 595 stipulates that a sales contract is a contract whereby the seller transfers the ownership of the subject matter to the buyer, and the buyer pays the price. 
Article 596 stipulates that a sales contract generally includes clauses such as the name, quantity, quality, price, payment terms, time, place and method of delivery of the subject matter, the time, place and method of payment of the price. 
Article 597 stipulates that if the seller fails to transfer the ownership of the subject matter in accordance with the agreement, the buyer may request it to bear the liability for breach of contract such as continuing to perform the contract, taking remedial measures or compensating for losses. If the subject matter sold by the seller does not belong to him or he has no right to dispose of it, it shall not affect the validity of the sales contract. 
Article 598 stipulates that the seller shall perform the obligation of delivering the subject matter or delivering the documents and materials necessary for taking delivery of the subject matter, and transferring the ownership of the subject matter in accordance with the agreement. 
Article 601 stipulates that the seller shall deliver the subject matter at the time agreed upon. If the time limit for delivery is agreed upon, the seller may deliver the subject matter at any time within the time limit; if the buyer has any objection, it shall notify the seller in a timely manner. 
Article 626 stipulates that the buyer shall pay the price in accordance with the agreed amount and time limit. If the payment place is not agreed upon or the agreement is unclear, and it cannot be determined in accordance with the provisions of Article 510 of this Law, the buyer shall pay at the place where the seller's business is located; if payment is made by bill of exchange, promissory note, check or other negotiable instruments, it shall be paid at the place where the negotiable instrument is payable; if the subject matter is real estate, it shall be paid at the place where the real estate is located.

Name: Divorce Dispute
Details:
Article 1076 stipulates that if both parties agree to divorce, they shall sign a divorce agreement and apply for divorce registration with the marriage registration authority. The divorce agreement shall specify the voluntary nature of the divorce and the agreement on the upbringing of minor children, the division of common property of the couple and the settlement of common debts. 
Article 1077 stipulates that the marriage registration authority shall, from the date of receiving the divorce registration application, set a cooling-off period of thirty days. Within the cooling-off period, either party may withdraw the divorce registration application to the marriage registration authority. After the cooling-off period of thirty days expires, both parties shall apply to the marriage registration authority for the issuance of a divorce certificate together; if they fail to apply, the divorce registration application shall be deemed to have been withdrawn. 
Article 1079 stipulates that if one party requests a divorce, it may apply to a people's court for mediation or directly file a divorce lawsuit with a people's court. The people's court shall conduct mediation when hearing a divorce case; if the feelings of both husband and wife have indeed broken down and the mediation fails, a divorce shall be granted. 
Article 1082 stipulates that during the period of pregnancy, within one year after childbirth or within six months after the termination of pregnancy, the husband shall not apply for a divorce; however, this restriction shall not apply if the wife applies for a divorce or the people's court deems it necessary to accept the husband's divorce request. 
Article 1084 stipulates that after divorce, the minor children shall be directly raised by the parent who is more suitable for raising them. If the parents disagree on the upbringing of the minor children who have reached the age of eight, the opinions of the minor children shall be taken into account. 
Article 1087 stipulates that after divorce, the common property of the couple shall be handled by both parties through negotiation; if the negotiation fails, the people's court shall make a judgment based on the specific circumstances of the property and in accordance with the principle of favoring the rights and interests of the children, women and the injured party.

Name: Residential Right Dispute
Details:
Article 366 stipulates that a person with the right of residence has the right to possess and use another person's residence in accordance with the contract agreement for the purpose of satisfying the needs of living and habitation. 
Article 367 stipulates that the establishment of the right of residence shall be based on a written contract. The contract for the right of residence generally includes clauses such as the name and residence of the parties, the location of the residence, the term of the right of residence, and the conditions for the establishment and elimination of the right of residence. 
Article 368 stipulates that the right of residence is established free of charge, unless otherwise agreed by the parties. To establish the right of residence, an application for registration of the right of residence shall be submitted to the registration authority. The right of residence shall be established upon registration. 
Article 369 stipulates that the right of residence shall not be transferred or inherited. The residence with the right of residence shall not be leased, unless otherwise agreed by the parties. 
Article 370 stipulates that the right of residence shall be eliminated when the term of the right of residence expires or the person with the right of residence dies. When the right of residence is eliminated, the registration of cancellation shall be handled in a timely manner. 
Article 371 stipulates that the establishment of the right of residence by will shall be applied with reference to the relevant provisions of this Chapter.

Name: Neighboring Relationship Dispute
Details:
Article 288 stipulates that the adjacent obligors of real estate shall properly handle the neighboring relationship in accordance with the principles of being conducive to production, convenient for life, unity and mutual assistance, and fairness and reasonableness. 
Article 292 stipulates that when the obligor of real estate must use the adjacent land or building for constructing or repairing buildings, or laying electric wires, cables, water pipes, heating pipes, gas pipes, etc., the obligor of that land or building shall provide the necessary convenience. 
Article 294 stipulates that the obligor of real estate shall not dump garbage, sewage, waste residue, etc. in violation of national regulations, and shall not emit harmful gases or noise, or conduct other acts that pollute the environment and interfere with the normal life of others. 
Article 295 stipulates that the obligor of real estate shall not endanger the safety of the adjacent real estate when excavating land, constructing buildings, laying pipelines, installing equipment, etc. 
Article 296 stipulates that when the obligor of real estate uses the adjacent real estate for water use, drainage, passage, pipeline laying, etc., he shall try to avoid causing damage to the adjacent real estate obligor. 
Article 298 stipulates that the obligor of real estate shall provide necessary convenience for the adjacent obligor to use water and drain water in accordance with the agreement of the parties, the local customs and habits, etc.

Name: Personal Injury Tort Liability Dispute
Details:
Article 1165 stipulates that if an actor causes damage to the civil rights and interests of others due to fault, he shall bear tort liability. If the law presumes that the actor is at fault and he cannot prove that he is not at fault, he shall bear tort liability. 
Article 1166 stipulates that if an actor causes damage to the civil rights and interests of others, regardless of whether the actor is at fault, if the law stipulates that he shall bear tort liability, such provisions shall apply. 
Article 1179 stipulates that if a person causes personal injury to others, he shall compensate for reasonable expenses such as medical expenses, nursing expenses, transportation expenses, nutrition expenses, and hospital food subsidies for treatment and rehabilitation, as well as the reduced income due to loss of work. If the injury causes disability, the auxiliary equipment fee and disability compensation shall also be paid; if the injury causes death, the funeral expense and death compensation shall also be paid. 
Article 1183 stipulates that if the personal rights and interests of a natural person are infringed upon and cause serious mental damage, the infringed person has the right to claim compensation for mental damage. If a natural person's specific property with personal significance is intentionally or negligently infringed upon and causes serious mental damage, the infringed person has the right to claim compensation for mental damage. 
Article 1187 stipulates that after the occurrence of damage, the parties may negotiate the method of paying compensation. If the negotiation fails, the compensation shall be paid in a lump sum; if it is really difficult to pay in a lump sum, it may be paid in installments, but the infringed person has the right to request the provision of corresponding guarantees. 
Article 1191 stipulates that if an employee of an employer causes damage to others in the course of performing his work tasks, the employer shall bear tort liability. After the employer bears the tort liability, it may recover from the employee who has intentional or gross negligence.

Name: Property Damage Tort Liability Dispute
Details:
Article 1165 stipulates that if an actor causes damage to the civil rights and interests of others due to fault, he shall bear tort liability. If the law presumes that the actor is at fault and he cannot prove that he is not at fault, he shall bear tort liability. 
Article 1184 stipulates that if a person infringes upon the property of others, the property loss shall be calculated according to the market price at the time of the loss or by other reasonable methods. 
Article 1185 stipulates that if a person intentionally infringes upon the intellectual property rights of others and the circumstances are serious, the infringed person has the right to claim corresponding punitive compensation. 
Article 1186 stipulates that if both the injured person and the actor have no fault for the occurrence of the damage, the loss shall be shared by both parties in accordance with the provisions of the law. 
Article 1190 stipulates that if a person with full capacity for civil conduct causes damage to others due to temporary loss of consciousness or control of his behavior and is at fault, he shall bear tort liability; if he is not at fault, he shall appropriately compensate the injured person according to his economic status. If a person with full capacity for civil conduct causes damage to others due to temporary loss of consciousness or control of his behavior due to drunkenness, abuse of narcotic drugs or psychotropic drugs, he shall bear tort liability. 
Article 1193 stipulates that if a contractor causes damage to a third party or himself in the course of completing the work, the ordering party shall not bear tort liability. However, if the ordering party is at fault for the ordering, instruction or selection, he shall bear corresponding liability.

Name: Owner's Right and Interest Dispute
Details:
Article 271 stipulates that the owner shall enjoy the right of ownership over the exclusive parts of the building such as the housing and the commercial housing in the building, and shall enjoy the right of co-ownership and common management over the common parts of the building such as the passageways, staircases and halls that are not exclusive to a single owner. 
Article 273 stipulates that the owner shall have the right to use the common parts of the building and share the income from the common parts. The expenses for the maintenance of the common parts shall be borne by the owner in proportion to the area of his exclusive parts. 
Article 282 stipulates that the income generated by the construction unit, property service enterprise or other manager using the owner's common parts shall belong to the owner after deducting reasonable costs. 
Article 283 stipulates that the owner shall have the right to request the construction unit, property service enterprise or other manager to disclose the income and expenditure of the use, operation and disposal of the common parts in accordance with the law, regulations and the agreement of the owner's convention. 
Article 285 stipulates that the property service enterprise or other manager shall perform the property service contract in accordance with the law, accept the supervision of the owner on the property service matters and expenses, and promptly respond to the owner's opinions and suggestions on the property service. 
Article 286 stipulates that the owner shall abide by the laws, regulations and the owner's convention, and shall not engage in acts that damage the common interests of the owners such as arbitrarily altering the structure of the building or damaging the load-bearing structure.

Name: Labor Service Relationship Injury Dispute
Details:
Article 1192 stipulates that if a person providing labor services causes damage to others in the course of providing labor services, the person accepting labor services shall bear tort liability. After the person accepting labor services bears the tort liability, he may recover from the person providing labor services who has intentional or gross negligence. If a person providing labor services is injured due to labor services, the liability shall be borne by both parties according to their respective faults. During the period of providing labor services, if a person providing labor services is injured by the act of a third party, the person providing labor services has the right to request the third party to bear tort liability, and also has the right to request the person accepting labor services to make compensation. After the person accepting labor services makes compensation, he may recover from the third party. 
Article 1193 stipulates that if a contractor causes damage to a third party or himself in the course of completing the work, the ordering party shall not bear tort liability. However, if the ordering party is at fault for the ordering, instruction or selection, he shall bear corresponding liability. 
Article 1179 stipulates that if a person causes personal injury to others, he shall compensate for reasonable expenses such as medical expenses, nursing expenses, transportation expenses, nutrition expenses, and hospital food subsidies for treatment and rehabilitation, as well as the reduced income due to loss of work. If the injury causes disability, the auxiliary equipment fee and disability compensation shall also be paid; if the injury causes death, the funeral expense and death compensation shall also be paid. 
Article 1183 stipulates that if the personal rights and interests of a natural person are infringed upon and cause serious mental damage, the infringed person has the right to claim compensation for mental damage. 
Article 1187 stipulates that after the occurrence of damage, the parties may negotiate the method of paying compensation. If the negotiation fails, the compensation shall be paid in a lump sum; if it is really difficult to pay in a lump sum, it may be paid in installments, but the infringed person has the right to request the provision of corresponding guarantees.

Name: Inheritance Dispute
Details:
Article 1121 stipulates that the inheritance shall start from the date of the death of the decedent. If several persons die in the same incident and it is impossible to determine the order of death, the one who has no heir shall die first. If there are heirs among them but their generations are different, the elder shall die first; if the generations are the same, they shall be deemed to have died at the same time, and neither shall inherit from the other, but their heirs shall inherit in accordance with the law. 
Article 1123 stipulates that inheritance shall be handled in accordance with the provisions of statutory inheritance; if there is a will, it shall be handled in accordance with testamentary inheritance or bequest; if there is an agreement on legacy support, it shall be handled in accordance with the agreement. 
Article 1127 stipulates that the statutory heirs shall be in the following order: (1) Spouse, children, parents; (2) Brothers and sisters, grandparents, maternal grandparents. The heirs of the first order shall inherit first; if there is no heir of the first order, the heirs of the second order shall inherit. The term "children" as used in this Law includes legitimate children, illegitimate children, adopted children and stepchildren who have a supportive relationship with their stepparents. The term "parents" as used in this Law includes natural parents, adoptive parents and stepparents who have a supportive relationship with their stepchildren. 
Article 1130 stipulates that the heirs of the same order shall inherit the estate in equal shares. For heirs who have difficulty in living and have no ability to work, they shall be given appropriate care when distributing the estate. Heirs who have made more contributions to the maintenance of the decedent may be given more shares when distributing the estate. Heirs who are able to work but do not fulfill their obligation of maintenance shall be given no or less shares when distributing the estate. 
Article 1133 stipulates that a natural person may make a will to dispose of his personal property and designate an heir to inherit his personal property in accordance with the provisions of this Law. A natural person may make a will to donate his personal property to the state, a collective or an organization or individual that is not an heir. 
Article 1142 stipulates that a will may be revoked or modified by the testator. If several wills are made and their contents are in conflict, the last will shall prevail. A notarial will shall not be revoked or modified by a self-written will, a written will, an oral will or a recorded will.

Name: Crime of Offering Bribes
Details:
Article 389 stipulates that the crime of offering bribes refers to the act of giving property to a state functionary for the purpose of seeking improper benefits. In economic transactions, anyone who, in violation of state regulations, gives property to a state functionary in a relatively large amount, or gives kickbacks or handling fees to a state functionary in various names in violation of state regulations, shall be deemed to have committed the crime of offering bribes.

A person who is coerced into giving property to a state functionary but does not obtain improper benefits shall not be convicted of offering bribes.

Whoever commits the crime of offering bribes shall be sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment of not more than five years or criminal detention and shall also be fined; if the circumstances are serious, or if major losses are caused to the interests of the state due to offering bribes to seek improper benefits, he shall be sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment of not less than five years but not more than ten years and shall also be fined; if the circumstances are especially serious, or if especially major losses are caused to the interests of the state, he shall be sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment of not less than ten years or life imprisonment and shall also be fined or have his property confiscated.

A briber who voluntarily confesses to the act of offering bribes before being prosecuted may be given a lighter or mitigated punishment. Among them, if the crime is relatively minor, or if he plays a key role in solving a major case, or if he has performed major meritorious service, he may be given a mitigated punishment or exempted from punishment.

Name: Crime of Embezzlement
Crime of Robbery
Crime of Fraud
Details: Article 266 stipulates that whoever defrauds public or private property in a relatively large amount shall be sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment of not more than three years, criminal detention or public surveillance and shall also be fined or be fined alone; if the amount involved is huge or the circumstances are serious, he shall be sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment of not less than three years but not more than ten years and shall also be fined; if the amount involved is especially huge or the circumstances are especially serious, he shall be sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment of not less than ten years or life imprisonment and shall also be fined or have his property confiscated. Where this Law provides otherwise, such provisions shall prevail.

Name: Crime of Snatching
Details:
Article 267 stipulates that whoever snatches public or private property in a relatively large amount or snatches property many times shall be sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment of not more than three years, criminal detention or public surveillance and shall also be fined or be fined alone; if the amount involved is huge or the circumstances are serious, he shall be sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment of not less than three years but not more than ten years and shall also be fined; if the amount involved is especially huge or the circumstances are especially serious, he shall be sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment of not less than ten years or life imprisonment and shall also be fined or have his property confiscated.

Whoever snatches property while carrying a weapon shall be convicted and punished in accordance with the provisions of Article 263 of this Law.

Name: Crime of Assembling a Crowd to Engage in Affrays
Crime of Extortion
Details: Article 274 stipulates that whoever extorts public or private property in a relatively large amount or extorts property many times shall be sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment of not more than three years, criminal detention or public surveillance and shall also be fined or be fined alone; if the amount involved is huge or the circumstances are serious, he shall be sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment of not less than three years but not more than ten years and shall also be fined; if the amount involved is especially huge or the circumstances are especially serious, he shall be sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment of not less than ten years and shall also be fined.

Name: Crime of Illegal Detention
Details:
Article 238 stipulates that whoever illegally detains another person or illegally deprives another person of his personal freedom by other means shall be sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment of not more than three years, criminal detention, public surveillance or deprivation of political rights. If there are circumstances of assault or insult, he shall be given a heavier punishment.

Whoever commits the crime mentioned in the preceding paragraph and causes serious injury to a person shall be sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment of not less than three years but not more than ten years; if he causes death to a person, he shall be sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment of not less than ten years. Whoever causes disability or death to a person by violence shall be convicted and punished in accordance with the provisions of Articles 234 and 232 of this Law.

Whoever illegally detains or takes into custody another person to demand repayment of a debt shall be punished in accordance with the provisions of the preceding two paragraphs.

A state functionary who commits any of the crimes mentioned in the preceding three paragraphs by taking advantage of his position shall be punished in accordance with the provisions of the preceding three paragraphs.

Name: Crime of Intentional Injury
Details:
Article 234 stipulates that whoever intentionally injures another person's body shall be sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment of not more than three years, criminal detention or public surveillance.

Whoever commits the crime mentioned in the preceding paragraph and causes serious injury to a person shall be sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment of not less than three years but not more than ten years; if he causes death to a person or causes serious disability to a person by especially cruel means, he shall be sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment of not less than ten years, life imprisonment or death. Where this Law provides otherwise, such provisions shall prevail.

Name: Crime of Rape
Illegally Restricting Others' Personal Freedom
Details: Article 40 stipulates that whoever illegally restricts others' personal freedom, illegally invades others' residences or illegally searches others' bodies shall be detained for not less than ten days but not more than fifteen days and fined not less than 500 yuan but not more than 1000 yuan; if the circumstances are minor, he shall be detained for not less than five days but not more than ten days and fined not less than 200 yuan but not more than 500 yuan.

Name: Assaulting Others or Intentionally Injuring Others' Bodies
Details: Article 43 stipulates that whoever beats others or intentionally injures others' bodies shall be detained for not less than five days but not more than ten days and fined not less than 200 yuan but not more than 500 yuan; if the circumstances are minor, he shall be detained for not more than five days or fined not more than 500 yuan. Whoever commits any of the following acts shall be detained for not less than ten days but not more than fifteen days and fined not less than 500 yuan but not more than 1000 yuan: (1) Beating or injuring others in a gang; (2) Beating or injuring the disabled, pregnant women, persons under the age of fourteen or persons over the age of sixty; (3) Beating or injuring others many times or beating or injuring more than one person at a time.

Name: Threatening Others' Personal Safety, Insulting or Defaming Others
Details: Article 42 stipulates that whoever commits any of the following acts shall be detained for not more than five days or fined not more than 500 yuan; if the circumstances are more serious, he shall be detained for not less than five days but not more than ten days and may also be fined not more than 500 yuan: (1) Sending threatening letters or using other methods to threaten others' personal safety; (2) Publicly insulting others or fabricating facts to defame others; (3) Sending obscene, insulting, threatening or other information many times to interfere with others' normal life; (4) Peeping, secretly photographing, eavesdropping or spreading others' privacy.

Name: Theft, Fraud, Extortion of Public or Private Property
Details: Article 49 stipulates that whoever steals, defrauds, coerces, robs, loots or extorts public or private property, or intentionally damages public or private property, shall be detained for not less than five days but not more than ten days and may also be fined not more than 500 yuan; if the circumstances are more serious, he shall be detained for not less than ten days but not more than fifteen days and may also be fined not less than 1000 yuan.

Name: Provocation and Disturbance
Details: Article 26 stipulates that whoever commits any of the following acts of provocation and trouble-making shall be detained for not less than five days but not more than ten days and may also be fined not more than 500 yuan; if the circumstances are more serious, he shall be detained for not less than ten days but not more than fifteen days and may also be fined not less than 1000 yuan: (1) Fighting with others arbitrarily; (2) Chasing or intercepting others; (3) Forcibly taking or demanding public or private property; (4) Other acts of provocation and trouble-making that disrupt public order.

Name: Illegally Carrying Controlled Instruments
Details: Article 32 stipulates that whoever illegally carries guns, ammunition or controlled knives, police equipment and other regulated articles shall be detained for not less than five days but not more than ten days and may also be fined not more than 500 yuan; if the circumstances are minor, he shall be detained for not more than five days or fined not more than 500 yuan. Whoever illegally manufactures, trades, transports, mails or stores the above-mentioned regulated articles shall be detained for not less than ten days but not more than fifteen days and may also be fined not less than 500 yuan but not more than 1000 yuan; if the circumstances are serious, criminal responsibility shall be investigated in accordance with the law.

Name: Disturbing Public Place Order
Details: Article 23 stipulates that whoever intentionally disrupts the order of public places such as stations, wharves, airports, shopping malls, parks or exhibition halls, or refuses to listen to dissuasion after disrupting the order of public transport vehicles, shall be detained for not less than five days but not more than ten days and may also be fined not more than 500 yuan; if the circumstances are minor, he shall be detained for not more than five days or fined not more than 500 yuan.

Name: Smoking or Injecting Drugs
Details: Article 72 stipulates that whoever smokes or injects drugs, or illegally possesses a small amount of drugs, shall be detained for not less than ten days but not more than fifteen days and may also be fined not less than 2000 yuan but not more than 5000 yuan; if the circumstances are minor, he shall be detained for not more than five days or fined not more than 500 yuan.

Name: Gambling
Details: Article 70 stipulates that whoever participates in gambling with a relatively large amount of money, or organizes others to gather for gambling, or provides conditions for gambling shall be detained for not more than five days or fined not more than 500 yuan; if the circumstances are more serious, he shall be detained for not less than ten days but not more than fifteen days and fined not less than 500 yuan but not more than 3000 yuan.

Name: Molesting Others or Intentionally Exposing One's Body in Public Places
Details: Article 44 stipulates that whoever molests others, or intentionally exposes his body in a public place with vicious circumstances, shall be detained for not less than five days but not more than ten days; whoever molests the disabled, mentally ill persons or persons under the age of fourteen, or has other serious circumstances, shall be detained for not less than ten days but not more than fifteen days.

Name: Administering Penalty Without Statutory Basis
Details: Article 3 stipulates that administrative penalties shall be imposed in accordance with the law; if there is no legal basis, no administrative penalty shall be imposed. Whoever administers a penalty without statutory basis shall be deemed to have committed an illegal act.

Name: Violating Statutory Procedures in Administrative Penalty
Details: Article 4 stipulates that the imposition of administrative penalties shall follow the principles of openness and fairness, and must comply with statutory procedures. If the statutory procedures are violated, the administrative penalty shall be revoked, changed or confirmed as illegal in accordance with the law.

Name: Imposing Heavier Penalty Due to Party's Defense
Details: Article 45 stipulates that the party has the right to state and defend. The administrative organ shall fully listen to the opinions of the party. The party shall not be given a heavier penalty because of his defense.

Name: Refusing to Inform Party of Right to Defense
Details: Article 44 stipulates that before making an administrative penalty decision, the administrative organ shall inform the party of the facts, reasons and basis for making the decision, as well as the rights enjoyed by the party in accordance with the law, including the right to defense.

Name: Penalizing Minors Under Fourteen
Details: Article 30 stipulates that if a person under the age of fourteen commits an illegal act, no administrative penalty shall be imposed, and his guardian shall be ordered to discipline him.

Name: Exceeding Statutory Authority to Impose Penalty
Details: Article 15 stipulates that administrative penalties shall be set and imposed in accordance with the scope of authority prescribed by law. No administrative organ or organization shall set or impose administrative penalties beyond its statutory authority.

Name: Failing to Make Written Penalty Decision
Details: Article 51 stipulates that the administrative penalty decision shall be made in writing, which shall include the name or address of the party, the basis of facts and law, the type of penalty, and the rights of administrative reconsideration or litigation.

Name: Illegally Seizing or Detaining Party's Property
Details: Article 59 stipulates that when collecting evidence, the administrative organ may seal up or seize the property related to the illegal act. The sealed up or seized property shall be properly kept and shall not be used or damaged without authorization.

Name: Imposing Penalty Beyond Statutory Time Limit
Details: Article 60 stipulates that the administrative organ shall make a decision on administrative penalty within the statutory time limit. If it fails to make a decision within the statutory time limit without justifiable reasons, it shall be deemed an illegal act.

Name: Refusing to Compensate for Damages Caused by Illegal Penalty
Details: Article 77 stipulates that if an administrative organ imposes an administrative penalty in violation of the law and causes damage to the legitimate rights and interests of the party, it shall compensate in accordance with the provisions of the Administrative Compensation Law.

Name: Failing to Conclude Written Labor Contract
Details: Article 10 stipulates that an employer and a worker shall conclude a written labor contract when establishing an labor relationship. If a labor relationship has been established but no written labor contract has been concluded within one month from the date of employment, the employer shall pay double wages to the worker.

Name: Illegal Termination of Labor Contract
Details: Article 48 stipulates that if an employer illegally terminates or dissolves the labor contract, and the worker requests to continue performing the labor contract, the employer shall continue to perform it; if the worker does not request to continue performing it or the labor contract cannot be continued to be performed, the employer shall pay compensation in accordance with the provisions of Article 87 of this Law.

Name: Delaying or Withholding Labor Remuneration
Details: Article 30 stipulates that the employer shall pay labor remuneration to the worker in full and on time in accordance with the agreement of the labor contract and the provisions of the state. If the employer delays or withholds labor remuneration, the worker may apply to the local people's court for a payment order.

Name: Setting Illegal Probation Period
Details: Article 19 stipulates that the probation period shall be determined according to the term of the labor contract. The probation period for a labor contract with a term of more than three months but less than one year shall not exceed one month; for a term of more than one year but less than three years, it shall not exceed two months; for a fixed-term labor contract of more than three years or a non-fixed-term labor contract, it shall not exceed six months.

Name: Forcing Worker to Work Overtime
Details: Article 31 stipulates that the employer shall strictly implement the labor quota standard and shall not force or implicitly force workers to work overtime. If the employer arranges overtime work, it shall pay overtime wages to the workers in accordance with the relevant provisions of the state.

Name: Refusing to Pay Overtime Wages
Details: Article 31 stipulates that if the employer arranges overtime work, it shall pay overtime wages to the workers at a rate not less than 150% of the worker's own hourly wage for working overtime on weekdays, not less than 200% on rest days, and not less than 300% on statutory holidays.

Name: Illegal Collection of Property from Worker
Details: Article 9 stipulates that an employer shall not collect deposits, securities or other property from workers in the name of any reason, nor shall it require workers to provide guarantees or collect guarantees from workers in other forms.

Name: Failing to Pay Economic Compensation
Details: Article 46 stipulates that in cases such as the employer terminating the labor contract in accordance with the provisions of Article 36, 40, 41 of this Law, the employer shall pay economic compensation to the worker in accordance with the provisions of this Law.

Name: Discriminating Against Workers in Employment
Details: Article 3 stipulates that workers shall enjoy the right to equal employment and choice of occupation. Employers shall recruit workers on the principle of equality and voluntariness, and shall not discriminate against workers on the basis of gender, nationality, disability, etc.

Name: Refusing to Provide Labor Contract Text to Worker
Details: Article 16 stipulates that the labor contract shall come into force after both the employer and the worker sign or seal it. Both parties shall each hold one copy of the labor contract. If the employer refuses to provide the worker with a copy of the labor contract, it shall bear corresponding legal liabilities.
